page.title: 01OUR 'D' BLOCK
page.content: Our 'D' block is in the south west part of the island of Jersey. Well over half of the block is sea. The 'D'block covers St. Brelade's Bay, the rugged headland of Noirmont and the old village and harbour of St. Aubin. The sandy beach of St. Brelade's Bay is a great tourist attraction, and in the summer is crowded with visitors sunbathing, swimming, or taking part in water sports. The craggy cliffs provide homes for seagulls, and the gorse covered headlands have many lovely walks. Scattered about the headlands are many old war-time fortifications. The picturesque St. Aubin's village is another tourist attraction with its old houses, pubs, shops and boat filled harbour. 400 metres off-shore is St. Aubin's fort, now used as a centre for school field trips.
